page.title: 11ATTITUDES _ CHIGNALS.
page.content: The peaceful atmosphere of Mashbury and the surrounding area is much appreciated by its residents, although young people feel that there is little, if any, social life. The elderly feel that the area is poorly served by shops and there is inadequate public transport. The parish often gets cut off in winter, which is both difficult and dangerous for the elderly. The village as a whole feels that their is a lack of community spirit in the area . Many people dislike the gravel pits and also feel threatened by the new development of Stansted airport. Some villages are concerned that the farmers are destroying the local enviroment by removing hedgerows and also destroying ancient buildings.
